elements.title: Casals Forum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the walls of the Kronberg Academy's Casals Forum (pictured) are curved and covered with wood in a manner reminiscent of a string instrument?

elements.title: Richard Dixon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after his release from a hospital for the criminally insane, Richard Dixon burgled $16 from a credit union and hijacked a jet to Cuba?

elements.title: accountability partner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some evangelical Christians confess their sexual temptations to an accountability partner to maintain their sexual purity?

elements.title: John Allen Lewis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Allen Lewis printed the Los Angeles Star, the first newspaper to appear in Los Angeles in 1851, with two pages written in English and two in Spanish?

elements.title: Miller Arnold case (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Frederick the Great personally convicted six judges for their involvement in the Miller Arnold case and sentenced them to a custodial penalty?

elements.title: Halyna Kuzmenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Halyna Kuzmenko promoted the Ukrainization of the Makhnovist movement, successfully increasing the use of the Ukrainian language by Russian speakers?

elements.title: Canton Coolie Corps (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that recruitment to the British Canton Coolie Corps suffered due to false rumours that men would be used as human shields in the Second Opium War?

elements.title: Loch Ness Monster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there is a Loch Ness Monster in Williamsburg, Virginia?
